1.heading: Marvel Comics.
1.title: TV Stars.
1.author: [No author]
notes: Published no. 1 (Aug. 1978) - no. 4 (Feb. 1979), cf. Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide.
Stories based on Hanna-Barbera animated cartoons, including Captain Caveman, Silent Knight, Dynomutt, The Great Grape Ape, The Herculoids, Space Ghost.

3.heading: Marvel Comics.
3.title: Tales of Asgard.
3.author: [No author]
notes: Published v. 1, no. 1 (Oct. 1968) and v. 2, no. 1 (Feb. 1984).
About fictional Norse mythology and gods, in the context of the superhero series Thor.
Vol. 2, no. 1 published by Marvel Comics Group.

18.heading: Marvel Comics.
18.title: Teenage Wasteland
18.author: writer, Brian K
18.appears_in: Vaughan ; pencils, Adrian Alphona and Takeshi Miyazawa ; inks, Craig Yeung and David Newbold ; colors, UDON's Christina Strain with Brian Rebern.
notes: Contains material originally published in magazine form as Runaways #7-12.

Summary (from OCLC): Still on the run from their super-villain parents, this motley crew of super-powered kids finds a kindred spirit in a daring young stranger and welcomes him into the fold. But will he help them or tear them apart?

37.heading: Marvel Comics.
37.title: Thor : First Thunder
37.author: writer, Bryan J
37.appears_in: L. Glass ; artist, Tan Eng Huat ; additional inks, Victor Olazaba ; colorist, Jose Villarrubia ; letterer, Joe Sabino.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Thor : First Thunder #1-5."

Summary (from SkyRiver): While on a hiking trip in Norway, doctor Donald Blake becomes strangely connected to Thor, the banished God of Asgard, and must help him battle Thor's devious half-brother Loki.

39.author: writer: Dan Jurgens, Mike Grell & Geoff Johns ; pencils: Tom Raney, et al

42.heading: Marvel Comics.
42.title: Thor : Lord of Asgard
42.author: writer, Dan Jurgens with Jose H
42.appears_in: P. Armenta ; pencilers, Stuart Immonen, et al. ; inkers, Scott Koblish, et. al. ; colorists, Dave Kemp & Hi-Fi ; letterers, Richard Starkings & Wes Abbott & Saida Temofonte.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Thor #44-50."

Summary (from SkyRiver): After his father Odin's heroic sacrifice, Thor is called upon to rule Asgard, leaving the protection of Earth to the inexperienced Tarene, also known as Thor Girl, as he faces the grave threat of Desak, Destroyer of Pantheons.

46.heading: Marvel Comics.
46.title: Thor : the Black Galaxy Saga
46.author: writers, Tom DeFalco & Ron Frenz ; pencilers, Ron Frenz, Gary Hartle ; inkers, Joe Sinnott, et al
46.appears_in: ; colorists, George Roussos, Nel Yomtov ; letterers, Mike Heisler, Chris Eliopoulos, Clem Robinson.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Thor #419-425."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Thor, Hercules, and the Avengers deal with the threat of Stellaris on Earth, unaware that the Celestials and the High Evolutionary are preparing a challenge for them in the Black Galaxy unlike anything they have ever faced.

47.heading: Marvel Comics.
47.title: Thor : the Legend.
47.author: [No author]
notes: Booklet about the Marvel superhero Thor.

48.heading: Marvel Comics.
48.title: Thor : the World Eaters
48.author: writers, Matt Fraction, Dan Abnett & Andy Lanning ; artists, Pasqual Ferry with Salvador Larroca, Mark Brooks ; color artists, Matt Hollingsworth, et al
48.appears_in: ; letterers, John Workman, Virtual Calligraphy's Joe Sabino.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Thor #615-621 and #620.1 and Thor Spotlight."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Thor must rally his family of gods to defend Asgard, which resides in the skies above Oklahoma, from the World Eaters, a trans-dimensional force of evil with plans to, among other things, dominate and take over the home of the Norse gods.

50.heading: Marvel Comics.
50.title: Thor : Wolves of the North.
50.author: [No author]
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Thor: Wolves of the North, Thor: the Truth of History and Thor Annual #1."
Summary (from SkyRiver): Collects tales of Thor as he battles demon hordes set loose by Hela, visits Midgard's ancient Egypt, and discovers that time does not heal all wounds.

70.author: [No author]

72.heading: Marvel Comics.
72.title: Thunderbolts Classic. Vol. 1
72.author: Kurt Busiek & Peter David, writers ; Mark Bagley, et al
72.appears_in: , pencilers ; Vince Russell, et al., inkers.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Thunderbolts #1-5, #-1 and Annual '97; Incredible Hulk #449; Spider-Man team-up #7 and Tales of the Marvel Universe #1."

"Justice, like lightning! When the world's heroes disappear, a new team rises to take their place! Meet the Thunderbolts: Citizen V! Techno! MACH-1! Songbird! Meteorite! Atlas! But what dark secret are these heroes hiding? Read the stories that changed the way the world looks at redemption! Guest-starring the Hulk, Spider-Man, Black Widow and Franklin Richards!"

74.heading: Marvel Comics.
74.title: Thunderbolts Presents Zemo : Born Better
74.author: writer, Fabian Nicieza ; penciler, Tom Grummett.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Thunderbolts presents Zemo: Born Better, #1-4."
Summary (from SkyRiver): Baron Helmut Zemo hurtles back in time to encounter the truth about his family.

87.heading: Marvel Comics.
87.title: Tinker, Tailor, Mutant, Spy
87.author: writer, Brian K
87.appears_in: Vaughan ; artists, Michael Ryan ; with Manuel Garcia & Raul Fernndez.
notes: Contains material originally published in magazine form as Mystique #7-13.

"Mystique is a shape-shifting mutant and former terrorist, recruited by Professor Xavier of the X-Men to be a secret agent. Her current mission: to find and destroy a deadly new strain of smallpox, one that's spread telepathically! Problem is, she's not the only mutant who wants to get her hands on this potentially apocalyptic bioweapon."

88.heading: Marvel Comics.
88.title: To Russia, With Love

notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Wolverine First Class #5-8, Uncanny X-Men #139-140 and Wolverine and Power Pack #1."

89.title: To Serve and Protect

notes: "Originally published in magazine form as Captain America (Vol. 3) #1-7."

90.heading: Marvel Comics.
90.title: Todd McFarlane Spider-Man
90.author: writer David Michelinie ; artist, Todd McFarlane.
notes: Contains materials originally published in magazine form as Amazing Spider-man (vol. 1) #315-323, #325 and #328.

Summary: Spider-Man issues illustrated by Todd McFarlane, featuring a rematch between Spider-Man and Venom, the Assassin Nation Plot, and McFarlane's final issue which pits Spider-Man against the Hulk.

94.title: Tomb of Dracula Presents : Throne of Blood.
94.author: [No author]

95.heading: Marvel Comics.
95.title: Tomorrow Dies Today
95.author: Jason Aaron ; illustrated by Ron Garney, Esad Ribic.
notes: "Contains material originally in magazine form as Wolverine Weapon X #11-16 and Dark Reign the list."

Summary (from amazon.com via SkyRiver): "It's the debut of an all-new, all-different Deathlok. Killer cyborgs have come from the future to kill the heroes of today, while Wolverine embarks on an international pub crawl with a certain recently reborn Sentinel of Liberty. Beer and bullets galore!"

96.heading: Marvel Comics.
96.title: The Tomorrow People
96.author: writer, Mark Millar ; pencils, Adam Kubert, Andy Kubert ; inks, Art Thibert w/ Danny Miki.
notes: Contains material originally published in magazine form as Ultimate X-Men #1-6.

Summary (from SkyRiver): Banding together to create the X-Men, Cyclops, Beast, Storm, Colossus, Miracle Girl, and Professor Xavier try to stop the Sentinels from wiping out mutant-kind, forming a tentative alliance with members of Magneto's gang of homo sapien-hating mutants.

97.heading: Marvel Comics.
97.title: Top Dog.
97.author: [No author]
notes: Cover title: The Secret Life of Top Dog.

98.heading: Marvel Comics.
98.title: The Torch.
98.author: [No author]

99.heading: Marvel Comics.
99.title: The Torch
99.author: story, Alex Ross, Mike Carey & Jim Krueger ; script, Mike Carey ; artist, Patrick Berkenkotter.
notes: Logo of Dynamite Entertainment on cover.

Summary (from SkyRiver): The the original Human Torch is dead, buried with full military honors. But what does death mean for an artificial man? The Mad Thinker is determined to find out, with the reluctant help of the Torch's best and oldest friend.

103.heading: Marvel Comics.
103.title: Transfer of Power
103.author: writer, Bruce Jones ; pencils, Stuart Immonen ; inks, Scott Koblish.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Incredible Hulk #44-49."

105.heading: Marvel Comics.
105.title: Treasure Island
105.author: writer, Roy Thomas ; artist, Mario Gully ; adapted from the novel by Robert Louis Stevenson.
notes: "'Fifteen men on the dead man's chest

yo-ho-ho and a bottle of rum!' With this sinister snatch of piratical song echoing along the English coast, the mysterious Billy Bones ushers young Jim Hawkins into an undreamed-of world of danger and adventure on the far-flung, mist-shrouded Treasure Island. And over it all looms the towering shadow of the most famous corsair of them all, the ever-scheming, intriguing, and enigmatic Long John Silver."
"Contains material originally published in magazine form as Marvel Illustrated: Treasure Island #1-6."

106.heading: Marvel Comics.
106.title: The Trial of Galactus
106.author: John Byrne, writer/artist ; Jim Novak, letterer ; Glynis Wein, colorist ; Marc Siry, assistant editor, book design ; Ralph Macchio, editor ; Tom DeFalco, editor in chief.
notes: Originally appeared in issues 242-244 and 257-262 of The Fantastic Four.
Includes: Superbman vs. the Fantastical four; My bad guy...my enemy.

108.heading: Marvel Comics.
108.title: Trials & Tribulations
108.author: Paul Jenkins, writer ; Mark Buckingham, pencillers ; Wayne Faucher, inks ; Transparency Digital, colors.
notes: Contains material originally published in magazine form as Peter Parker: Spider-Man # 35, #37 and #48-50.

Summary (from SkyRiver): As Peter Parker attempts to use the lesson he learned from his uncle's death, that with power comes responsibility, he battles Vulture and Hammerhead and tries to explain his situation to Aunt May, who has learned of his alter ego.

110.heading: Marvel Comics.
110.title: Tron : Original Movie Adaptation
110.author: script, Peter David ; art, Mirco Pierfederici ; letters, Nate Piekos.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Tron: Original Movie Adaptation #1-2."
"Based on the screenplay written by Steven Lisberger."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Comics adaptation of the motion picture in which a programmer named Kevin Flynn is brought into the virtual world to take on the tryannical Master Control Program and restore order to the system.

113.heading: Marvel Comics.
113.title: True Believers
113.author: writer, Brian K
113.appears_in: Vaughan ; penciler, Adrian Alphona ; inker, Craig Yeung ; colorist, UDON's Christina Strain ; letterers, Virtual Caligraphy's Randy Gentile & Dave Sharpe.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Runaways #1-6".

114.heading: Marvel Comics.
114.title: The Trust
114.author: writer, Brian Michael Bendis ; artist, Leinil Yu.
notes: Contains material originally published in magazine form as: New Avengers #32-37 and Annual #2.
Summary (from SkyRiver): The superhero team fights Skrulls, the Hood, and other villains.

115.heading: Marvel Comics.
115.title: Truth : Red, White & Black.
115.author: [No author]
notes: In World War II, the serum that created Captain America is first tested on African American soldiers.

116.heading: Marvel Comics.
116.title: The Twelve.
116.author: [No author]
notes: "They are yesterday's men of tomorrow, today. After being placed in cryogenic suspension by the Nazis at the close of World War II, twelve mystery-men of the 1940s are found and revived in the far-flung future of 2008. With the world they knew just a faded memory, these dozen superhuman champions must now find a place for themselves in the strange and horrifying era in which they find themselves, the 21st Century"

contents.title: "The Fantastic Thriller of the Walking Corpses" (The Fiery Mask) p. 2-11
"The Strange Case of the Bloodless Corpses" (The Fiery Mask) p. 12-21

119.heading: Marvel Comics.
119.title: The 25 Coolest Dead Superheroes of All Time
119.author: created and produced by Brian Michael Bendis and Mike Avon Oeming ; coloring, Nick Filardi ; lettering and production, Chris Eliopoulos.
notes: "Portions of this novel were previously printed in the monthly Powers v. 2 comic-book series issues #25-30 and annual 2008."

"Walker vs. Pilgrim? Homicide detectives Christian Walker and Deena Pilgrim investigate murders specific to superhero cases, and they've both got a secret: They both have powers. One shall rise and one shall fall. This is the most important chapter of 'Powers' since the series debut. It is a story that will blow the roof off of everything you know about crime comics and superhero comics."
